intro: Sisymbrium kahikir, commonly known as the Kahikir mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other mustard plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Sisymbrium kahikir is typically found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and salty environments.
